--- title: Brachioradialis --- ![Left Humerus (Anterior view) @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Osteology/image207 gray1918 Left humerus. Anterior view.gif){#fig-gray1918-image207} ::: {.callout title="Reading list"} - Wrist Extensor and Brachioradialis Muscles @donnellyTravellSimonsSimons2019 - @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017 - MMT @weinstockNeuroKineticTherapyInnovative2010 ::: # Overview The *brachioradialis* muscle exists in the lateral forearm @jonesProjectFoundations2025. The brachioradialis along with the [ECRB]({{< var ref-extensor-carpi-radialis-brevis.path >}}), [ECRL]({{< var ref-extensor-carpi-radialis-longus.path >}}) form the *radial group of forearm muscles* @jonesProjectFoundations2025. ::: {#tbl-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Brachioradialis Lateral distal humerus
Lateral intermuscular septum		 Styloid process of Radius Radial n.
C5 - C6		 Elbow: Flexion, Semipronation (to 90°)
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} - Lateral Humerus (*Superior to lateral supracondylar ridge*) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - Lateral intermuscular septum @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ![Muscles that move the Forearm @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.25 Muscles That Move the Forearm.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.25} # Pathway {#pathway} From its [proximal origin](#origin) the brachioradialis is lateral to the [brachialis]({{< var ref-brachialis.path >}}) and superficial to the [common biceps brachii tendon]({{< var ref-biceps-brachii.tendon >}}) @jonesProjectFoundations2025. As the brachioradialis crosses the anterior-lateral elbow to form the *lateral wall of the cubital fossa* @jonesProjectFoundations2025. As it passes into the forearm, the brachioradialis acts as a border between the *anterior* and *posterior lateral forearm components* @jonesProjectFoundations2025. At the mid-forearm, the brachioradialis courses *laterally* to the [FCR]({{< var ref-flexor-carpi-radialis.path >}}) @jonesProjectFoundations2025. Between the brachioradialis and [FCR]({{< var ref-flexor-carpi-radialis.path >}}) the *superficial branch* of the radial nerve arises and crosses superficially over the extensor retinaculum of the hand @jonesProjectFoundations2025. As the brachioradialis courses distally to the wrist and its [distal insertion](#insertion), it lies *lateral* to the [radial artery]({{< var ref-radial-artery.path >}}) @jonesProjectFoundations2025. # Insertion {#insertion} Styloid process of the Radius @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Tendon {#tendon} # Innervation {#innervation} [Radial N.]({{< var ref-radial-nerve.path >}}) ([C5]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c5 >}}), [C6]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c6 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} - **Elbow**: Flexion @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - **Forearm**: Pronates or Supinates the arm to neutral [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020; @jonesProjectFoundations2025] ![Brachioradialis acting as a synergist for the Biceps Brachii @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.2 Prime Movers and Synergists.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.2} # Notes # Reflex {#reflex} Brachioradialis reflex can be used to assess the C6 nerve root @hongReliabilityDiagnosticAccuracy2022.
